newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Five children killed by mines in Chechnya.
newsitem.headline: Five children killed by mines in Chechnya.

text.p: Five children died on Sunday when they stepped on mines in the breakaway Russian region of Chechnya, Russian news agencies said.

The accident took place near a road about 10 km (six miles) from Chechnya's capital Grozny, Itar-Tass news agency quoted Chechen deputy prime minister Movladi Udugov as saying. The five, all boys, were aged between 10 and 12.
Interfax news agency quoted Udugov as saying that the incident was "related to a series of terrorist acts committed in recent days on the territory of Chechnya".

Six staffers of the International Committee of the Red Cross were murdered in their sleep at a Red Cross hospital compound southwest of Grozny last Tuesday, and six members of an ethnically mixed Grozny family were shot the following day.
A Russian family of four was killed at their home in Grozny on Friday in what officials also called a political act.
